AU.notes: May apply online using the Online Visitor e600 visa facility.

BJ.notes: Must have an international vaccination certificate.

CN.notes: Visa can be issued on arrival for those who need to enter China urgently for humanitarian reasons or have other urgent needs. Relevant supporting documents must be provided. This policy applies to all foreigners including citizens of Bangladesh.

CU.notes: Visa must be obtained in advance in lieu of a tourist card.

ET.notes: eVisa holders must arrive via Addis Ababa Bole International Airport

GA.notes: Electronic visa holders must arrive via Libreville International Airport.

GE.notes: eVisa available for holders of a valid Schengen visa or a valid visa from any of the OECD member countries or a valid residence permit of a Schengen or OECD country or a valid residence permit of UAE.

IN.notes:
No visa required for Diplomatic and Official Passport holders.
Visa fee waived for regular or ordinary passport holders.

IL.notes: Confirmation from Israeli government required before visa is issued.

JP.notes: No visa required for Diplomatic Passport holders.

KR.notes: Bangladeshi national who holds a visa, re-entry permit or permanent residency to enter the United States, Canada, Japan, Australia or New Zealand can enter South Korea without a visa for a stay of up to 30 days, if their purpose of visit is transit.

KG.notes: Electronic visa holders must arrive via Manas International Airport or Osh Airport or through land crossings with China (at Irkeshtam and Torugart), Kazakhstan (at Ak-jol, Ak-Tilek, Chaldybar, Chon-Kapka), Tajikistan (at Bor-Dobo, Kulundu, Kyzyl-Bel) and Uzbekistan (at Dostuk).

LB.notes: In addition to a visa, an approval should be obtained from the Immigration department of the General Directorate of General Security (La Surete Generale).

MX.notes: Visa is not required if holding U.S or Canadian permanent resident card.

MM.notes:
eVisa holders must arrive via Yangon, Nay Pyi Taw or Mandalay airports or via land border crossings with Thailand — Tachileik, Myawaddy and Kawthaung or India — Rih Khaw Dar and Tamu.
eVisa is available for tourism only.

OM.notes: Bangladeshi holding a GCC visa of certain categories (managers, sales executives, etc.) are granted a visit visa on arrival if they are coming directly from a GCC Country.

PK.notes:
Online Visa eligible.
Electronic Travel Authorization to obtain a visa on arrival for business purposes.

PH.notes: No visa required for Diplomatic and Official Passport holders for a stay of upto 30 days.

SM.notes: Visa not required if holding a valid Schengen Visa.

SG.notes:
No visa required for Diplomatic and Official Passport holders.
May obtain visa online.

SO.notes: Available at Bosaso Airport, Galcaio Airport and Mogadishu Airport.

SD.notes: Entry and transit is refused unless arriving for commercial delegations or as students studying at a Sudanese institute of higher education or university and holding a residence permit.

TN.notes: Visa on arrival for up to 15 days for valid residence permit holders of any country in the GCC (Bahrain, Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia and the UAE).

TR.notes:
No visa required for Diplomatic and Official passport holders
eVisa available for holders of a valid Schengen visa; a valid visa from any OECD member country (USA, Canada, etc.); or a valid residence permit of a Schengen or OECD country.
